projects.description:
I created an iOS app that streamlines workforce scheduling and management. Built with Swift, it uses Firebase for secure email authentication and a powerful database to keep everything organized.

Users can manage employees, assign work hours, schedule vacations, and generate PDF reports to share with contacts quickly and efficiently. This app boosts productivity and helps businesses stay in control of their team schedules with ease.
projects.title: Shift Manager
Market Basket Analysis - Supermarket
projects.description:
This project performed a market basket analysis on an extensive supermarket database with over 4.9 million records. The process included:

Data extraction and preparation from SQLite

Transaction transformation into one-hot encoding format

Calculation of association metrics (confidence and lift) between products

Generation of association rules with significance thresholds

Data enrichment with department and section information

Results export for dashboard and analysis

Calculated Metrics:

Confidence: Measures the probability of purchasing product B given that product A was purchased

Lift: Indicates whether the relationship between products is greater than expected by chance (lift > 1 = positive association)
projects.code_snippet:
from itertools import combinations

# Define a threshold for minimum confidence
confidence_threshold = 0.05
associations = []

# Generate product combinations and calculate confidence and lift
for antecedent, consequent in combinations(df_transactions.columns, 2):
    # Support of the antecedent
    support_a = df_transactions[antecedent].mean()
    
    # Calculate confidence
    conf = confidence(antecedent, consequent)
    if conf > confidence_threshold:
        associations.append({
            'antecedent': antecedent,
            'consequent': consequent,
            'support_a': round(support_a * 100, 1),
            'confidence': round(conf * 100, 1),
            'lift': round(lift(antecedent, consequent), 1)
        })

# Convert associations to a DataFrame
df_associations = pd.DataFrame(associations)
df_associations.sort_values(by='lift', ascending=False, inplace=True)
